{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2967216,"name":"Elliot Scher","username":"Gandagorn","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gandagorn/{size}/267112_2.png","created_at":"2021-09-03T15:54:49.414Z","cooked":"

Hello Chief Delphi!
I am the head programmer for team 2815 out of Columbia SC and I am having a problem with the CANEncoder class in the REVRobotics API

It says the constructor has been depreciated but I can’t find any other posts on CD or depreciation announcements on the REVRobotics API CANEncoder class: CANEncoder (SPARK-MAX-roboRIO API)

Has anyone else had this problem and if so how did you fix it?

Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2021-09-03T15:55:20.723Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":98,"reads":135,"readers_count":134,"score":517.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":395848,"topic_slug":"canencoder-class-has-depreciated-constructors-help","display_username":"Elliot Scher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/content/sw/max/sw-docs/java/com/revrobotics/CANEncoder.html#%3Cinit%3E(com.revrobotics.CANSparkMax,com.revrobotics.EncoderType,int)","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"CANEncoder (SPARK-MAX-roboRIO API)","clicks":14}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)"},"post_url":"/t/canencoder-class-has-depreciated-constructors-help/395848/1","custom_user_title":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":2967218,"name":"Allen Nuttle","username":"nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png","created_at":"2021-09-03T16:09:18.497Z","cooked":"

Use the getEncoder() or getAlternateEncoder() method of the associated CANSparkMax object.

I’m sorry if I sound dumb but how would you do that?

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2021-09-03T18:37:41.482Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":395848,"topic_slug":"canencoder-class-has-depreciated-constructors-help","display_username":"Elliot Scher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":14283,"username":"nuttle","name":"Allen Nuttle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nuttle/{size}/124105_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)"},"post_url":"/t/canencoder-class-has-depreciated-constructors-help/395848/3","custom_user_title":"2815A (19-23) | 190M (23...)","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":2967238,"name":"Tyler Veness","username":"calcmogul","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/calcmogul/{size}/128045_2.png","created_at":"2021-09-03T18:44:19.601Z","cooked":"
github.com

REVrobotics/SPARK-MAX-Examples/blob/master/Java/Encoder Feedback Device/src/main/java/frc/robot/Robot.java#L38

    

  1.  * existing CANSparkMax object. The assumed encoder type is the hall effect,
    2. 

  2.  * or a sensor type and counts per revolution can be passed in to specify
    3. 

  3.  * a different kind of sensor. Here, it's a quadrature encoder with 4096 CPR.
    4. 

  4.  */
    5. 

  5. private CANEncoder m_encoder;
    6. 

  6. 

  7. @Override
    8. 

  8. public void robotInit() {
    9. 

  9.   // initialize SPARK MAX with CAN ID
    10. 

  10.   m_motor = new CANSparkMax(deviceID, MotorType.kBrushed);
    11. 

  11.   m_encoder = m_motor.getEncoder(EncoderType.kQuadrature, 4096);
    12. 

  12.   
    13. 

  13.   m_motor.restoreFactoryDefaults();
    14. 

  14. 

  15.   /**
    16. 

  16.    * In order to use PID functionality for a controller, a CANPIDController object
    17. 

  17.    * is constructed by calling the getPIDController() method on an existing
    18. 

  18.    * CANSparkMax object
    19. 

  19.    */
    20. 

  20.   m_pidController = m_motor.getPIDController();
    21. 

  21.
